CatDescriptText: Mrs. N. B. Jackson, widowed housewife, 728 Bryn Mawr Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think common-law marriage should be outlawed?" Answer reads: "If I had my way, I would break up everyone living in a common-law marriage arrangement. Such things are a ruination of the young.  In my hometown of Tuskegee the people did not associate with anyone living common-law.  I think that those persons living that way should be driven out of town."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of N. B. Jackson, wearing dark coat with braided trim, knitted light colored scarf, eyeglasses, and dark hat, standing in front of brick wall, pedestrian and buildings in background
